results.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
results.headline_credit: Canada and United States of America, 2002
results.brief_description: A young Greek woman falls in love with a non-Greek and struggles to get her family to accept him while she comes to terms with her heritage and cultural identity.
results.description: A young Greek woman falls in love with a non-Greek and struggles to get her family to accept him while she comes to terms with her heritage and cultural identity.

results.title: My big chance
results.creator_credit: Dennis Tupicoff and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A short animated film about an encounter between an employee and his boss. The boss’s cliches about the future of the business are illustrated by images on the screen. The future for the company and the right people is bright, but this employee is fired.

results.title: My best mate
results.creator_credit: Aaron Austin and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Huss was polite, generous and non-judgemental. Big Issue vendor, Aaron Austin paints a portrait of a man from the war-torn country of Somalia who, despite his violent upbringing, was kind to everyone who crossed his path. A soccer fan and storyteller, Huss was taken from Aaron when he was stabbed in the doorway of his flat in 2007.

results.title: My best girl [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Sam Taylor, Mary Pickford and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Displaying a fine talent for comedy in “My best girl”, Mary Pickford plays Maggie Johnson, a clerk at a dime store who struggles to reconcile her devotion to her family with her personal desires. Along with her postman father and eccentric mother, Maggie lives with Liz, her selfish and wanton sister. Liz provides Pickford’s character with a moral contrast, as Maggie nearly sacrifices all to keep her family intact. Charles “Buddy” Rogers (Pickford’s future husband) plays Joe Grant, son of the dime store owner where Maggie works, posing as a humble clerk in order to prove his stoicism to his father. At times the film overflows with romantic melodrama and sentimentality, but it also contains some classic silent film sequences and makes numerous salient dramatic points about the class-consciousness of American society. The film also serves as a deft indicator of the conflicts rife within American society in the 1920’s Depression, depicting the elite as oblivious to the daily struggles of the impoverished working class. Cast also includes Sunshine Hart, Lucien Littlefield, Hobart Bosworth and Carmelita Geraghty as Liz. Silent film with musical soundtrack written by David Michael Frank.

results.title: My best friends wedding. Steel magnolias
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, P.J. Hogan, Ray Stark, Ronald Bass, Jerry Zucker, Rastar Films and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: My best friend’s wedding (103 mins) stars Julia Roberts as the lovelorn food critic Julianne, who discovers she wants to spend the rest of her life with her best friend the day he pops the question to someone else. She has four days to break up the wedding and help her best friend discover that she’s the one. With an outstanding supporting cast including Cameron Diaz and Rupert Everett, this film takes the cake as the romantic comedy of the year. In “Steel Magnolias” (112 mins), six strong Southern belles enjoy a friendship that spans the boundaries of age and status. Despite their differences they share each other’s strength, hope and loyalty to survive the cycles of life, birth, and death to emerge stronger, closer and still laughing. An ensemble cast including Julia Roberts, Sally Field, Olympia Dukakis, Dolly Parton, Shirley MacLaine and Darryl Hannah make this heartrending story, based on the stage play of the same name by Robert Harling, a bittersweet sentimental journey through the lives of this group of truly remarkable women.

results.title: My Best Friend's Wedding
results.brief_description: When she receives word that her longtime platonic pal Michael O’Neal is getting married to debutante Kimberly Wallace, food critic Julianne Potter realizes her true feelings for Michael — and sets out to sabotage the wedding.

constellations_other.name: Atari’s Basketball
constellations_other.description: Released in 1979, just in time for the arcade heydays of the early 1980s, Atari’s Basketball was the first basketball game to use a trackball as the input mechanic and a 45-degree angled side view. This set the standard for basketball games that followed.

results.title: My belle
results.brief_description: An impressionistic portrait of Michelle, a performer preparing for her act, caught between private and public worlds. Made with the assistance of the Creative Development Branch of the Australian Film Commission. Music by Bill Mcdonald and featuring Michelle Tozer. No spoken word.

results.title: My bed, your bed
results.brief_description: In an isolated community, a man and woman are promised under the traditional laws of marriage. The time has come for Delia and Alvin to move in together. Things don’t turn out as smoothly as they might. My Bed, Your Bed explores notions of Aboriginal identity through an examination of the ways that Aboriginal people living in Central Australian bush communities adopt values from both contemporary and traditional works.
